MemoryInfobox.name: Pan's Flute
MemoryInfobox.description: 'One of the recovered maps leads here, to the location of the legendary flute of Pan.'

General_Description: '''Pan's Flute''' was a virtual representation of one of [[Kassandra]]'s genetic memories, relived by [[Layla Hassan]] through the Portable [[Animus|Animus HR-8.5]].
Section_Description: Kassandra followed one of [[Anaximander]]'s maps to the location of a flute which allegedly belonged to the god [[Pan]].
Section_Dialogue:
Kassandra arrived at a [[Cave of Pan, Attika|cave]] in the mountains near [[Marathon Beach]], the entrance of which was surrounded by boulders that resembled [[goat]]s.
*'''Kassandra:''' ''This must be the place.''
Inside, she discovered it to be occupied by the [[Followers of Ares]]. As she navigated the cave, she also found [[Sparta]]n prisoners and freed them. Going further inside, she killed the leader guarding piles of treasures. On top of one sat the flute.
*'''Kassandra:''' ''I see it.''
Kassandra took it...
*'''Kassandra:''' ''Pan's flute! Xenia will love this.''
...and left the cave.
Section_Behind_the_scenes: According to [[Greek mythology]], Pan's Flute is called [[Syrinx]]. She was a [[nymph]] that was turned into reeds with the help of water nymphs to hide from Pan. She was cut and crafted into the first flute after being found by Pan.
Section_References:
*''[[Assassin's Creed: Odyssey]]''

Structured_Dialogue.content: Kassandra arrived at a [[Cave of Pan, Attika|cave]] in the mountains near [[Marathon Beach]], the entrance of which was surrounded by boulders that resembled [[goat]]s.

Inside, she discovered it to be occupied by the [[Followers of Ares]]. As she navigated the cave, she also found [[Sparta]]n prisoners and freed them. Going further inside, she killed the leader guarding piles of treasures. On top of one sat the flute.
